about_the_game:
Team up with your epic fantasy buddies as dungeon adventurers, or embody ultimate evil as a dungeon administrator. Two sides of the same game.

This ain't your daddy's player-directed RPG. Our approach is much more zany.

It's a party-based RPG if you're in the party of adventurers, and a dungeon builder/manager if you're the head honcho. The dungeon master sets up themed rooms with obstacles, enemies, and traps. The adventurers try and survive the latest creation while the next one is being forged. When the adventurers survive a room, they get a box of random goodies to assist them on the next stage of the adventure...badventure.

The whole experience is given an irreverent veneer with our tongues so far in our cheeks we can barely speak.

Features:
● Multiplayer! Is a necessity. Hope you have internet.
● Budget dungeon building with several themes, layouts, enemies, and traps
● An overly complicated combat system
● Character customization and names, so you can really be who you are in our game
● Mechanics designed to create division within the party for lols
● More coming soon...listen I've only had a year to work on this so far.

short_description: Badventure is a kooky player-directed RPG, like DnD but tastier and more unhealthy. One player will become the dungeon master, creating rooms with obstacles, enemies, and traps. The rest of the players band together as a party of adventurers to overcome the challenges set for them. Huzzah!
